bibl.title: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [April 29, 1899]

div1.p: Reed writes about his vacation and relates his plans to go to Puerto Principe.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [April 29, 1899]
div1.opener:
U. S. Army Hospital Ship Missouri.
Wednesday Morning.
Before Breakfast.

closer.seg:
P.S. we sail for Nuevitas
this afternoon at 2 o'clock, so Major
Arthur has just told me. This will
land us there early Friday morning, just
about the time you are nearing Wash-
ington on your Potomac Steamer- I
hope to run up to Puerto Principe, the
same day & get back to the ship by Monday
May, 2nd. We will then return to
Havana, via Matanzas, & should be here
about May 4th on our return trip.
Darboy & I chatted till nearly midnight
up on the ship's bridge- A more beautiful
night I never saw, with the moon at her
full & Havana & the Cuban Hills standing
out as in some beautiful painting.
We slept like so many “tops”- Darboy
was much amused at his mother's
trouble in getting on & off the Missouri-
He simply looks splendidly & seems to be
so happy- about 9 o'clock we will leave
ship & see something more of Havana.
We'll have a day here, when we get back
next week. I am enjoying the trip very
much- I know that you & little daughter
will enjoy yourselves at dear Sunny Acres.
Wish I could be with you, but will
not reach New York in time for that.
Much love to Mrs. Gordon- Hope that
this will reach you by Sunday --.
With love & kisses for my precious babies,
in which Darboy joins,
Devotedly,
Papa.
